citation.excerpt:
By Shuchang Tao, Qi Cao, Huawei Shen, Junjie Huang, Yunfan Wu and Xueqi Cheng 
Published at CIKM 2021

description.excerpt: In this paper, we focus on an extremely limited scenario of **single node injection evasion attack,** i.e., the attacker is only allowed to inject one single node during the test phase to hurt GNN’s performance. Single node injection evasion attack has the advantages of being difficult to detect and low in cost. Taking social networks as an example, it is very difficult for both the detection system and the user to detect the addition of one single malicious follower, especially compared with existing node injection methods which lead to a sudden emergence of multiple followers.

This repository is our Pytorch implementation of our paper: 
Single Node Injection Attack against Graph Neural Networks

We propose a Generalizable Node Injection Attack model, namely G-NIA, to improve the attack efficiency while ensuring the attack performance. G-NIA generates the discrete edges by Gumbel-Top-𝑘 and captures the coupling effect between network structure and node features by a sophisticated designed model. 
Further details can be found in our paper.

Our proposed model G-NIA outperforms all the baselines (or performs the same as the state-of-the-art baseline) on all datasets attacking all the three GNNs. 
Download Citeseer, Reddit (the subgraph in our paper), ogbproducts (the subgraph in our paper) from Here.
G-NIA model from "Single Node Injection Attack against Graph Neural Networks" (CIKM 2021)

invocation.excerpt: Put datasets.zip in this directory and unzip it.

long_title.excerpt: Single Node Injection Attack against Graph Neural Networks

usage.excerpt:
***Example Usage***

`python -u run_gnia.py --suffix single_gcn --nepochs 10000 --lr 1e-5 --connect True --epsst 50 --epsdec 1 --patience 500 --dataset 12k_reddit --edgetau 0.01 --surro_type gcn --victim_type gcn --batchsize 32  `

For detailed description of all parameters, you can run

`python -u run_gnia.py --help`
